p: The experiments were performed in the biosafety level 4 (BSL4) laboratory at the National Microbiology Laboratory in Winnipeg, Canada, under Animal Use Document (AUD) H-16-015. The experiments described in the AUD were approved by the Animal Care Committee (ACC) at the Canadian Science Center for Human and Animal Health and adhered to the national regulations and guidelines outlined by the Canadian Council on Animal Care. To ameliorate suffering, animals were euthanized with an intracardiac injection of pentobarbital sodium if the clinical score reached ≥25 (or ≥20 for control NHPs), following guidelines set by the ACC.
